text: The process starts when the sales department receives an order. A member of the sales department can then reject or accept the order for a customized bike. If the member of the sales department rejects the offer, the process instance is finished. If the member of the sales department accepts the offer, the member of the sales department informs the storehouse and the engineering department. The storehouse immediately processes the part list of the order and checks the required quantity of each part. If the part is available in-house, the storehouse reserves the part. If the part is not available, the storehouse back-orders the part. In the meantime, the engineering department prepares everything for the assembling of the ordered bicycle. After the reserving or back-ordering parts activity and the preparation activity have finished, the engineering department assembles the bicycle. Afterwards, the sales department ships the bicycle to the customer and finishes the process instance.

The process starts with the customer approaching the lemonade stand. The customer orders their desired drink and pays the seller. The seller takes the payment and prepares the drink. The seller hands the customer their drink and provides the customer with a receipt. The customer takes their drink and leaves the stand. The process is complete.

The process starts with the data scientist gathering the necessary data for the dataset. This could include images, text, audio, or video. The data scientist then preprocesses the data, which may include cleaning, normalizing, and formatting the data. Next, the data scientist splits the data into training and testing sets. The training set is used to train the deep learning model while the testing set is used to evaluate its performance. Finally, the data scientist labels the data in order to create the deep learning dataset. The process is complete.

First, the Manager checks the open leads. Afterwards, the Manager selects the top five open leads. The Manager then tells the Sales Assistant to call the contact person of the leads. The Sales Assistant calls each customer. If someone is interested, the Sales Assistant sends a note to the Manager. The Manager then processes the lead. Otherwise, the Sales Assistant calls the next customer.

The process starts with the data scientist gathering the necessary data for the model. The data scientist then cleans and pre-processes the data to prepare it for modeling. The data scientist then splits the data into training and testing sets. The data scientist then builds the machine learning model using the training set. The model is then evaluated by the data scientist using the testing set to measure its accuracy. The data scientist then tunes the model to improve its accuracy. Finally, the data scientist deploys the model and monitors its performance. The process is complete.

The process starts with the artist setting up their equipment in the recording studio. The engineer sets up the microphones and sound equipment to capture the artist's performance. The artist then performs the song and the engineer records the song. The engineer then mixes and edits the track to create a final version of the song. The engineer then masters the track to make sure it is ready for release. The artist releases the song. The process is complete.

The process starts with the curator selecting the artwork to be featured in the exhibition. The curator then arranges the artwork in the gallery space according to their vision. The gallery staff hang the artwork on the walls and set up any additional displays. The curator then reviews the setup and makes any necessary adjustments. The marketing team creates promotional materials for the exhibition and distributes them to potential visitors. The gallery staff then open the doors to the public and welcome visitors to the exhibition. The process is complete.

The process starts with the advertising team brainstorming ideas for the campaign. The team then creates a concept and develops a strategy for the campaign. The team then creates the visuals and content for the campaign, such as images, videos, and copy. The team then works with media outlets to determine where the campaign will be placed. The team then launches the campaign and monitors its performance. Finally, the team evaluates the success of the campaign and makes adjustments as needed. The process is complete.

The process starts with the patient making an appointment with their doctor. The patient arrives at the hospital and checks in at the reception desk. The receptionist verifies the patient's identity and insurance information. The patient is then directed to the appropriate department for their treatment by the receptionist. The doctor examines the patient and orders any necessary tests or treatments. The patient receives the treatment and the doctor gives the patient instructions on how to care for themselves at home. The patient pays for their treatment and leaves the hospital. The process ends.

The process starts with the customer searching for a flight online. The customer selects the desired flight and enters their personal information. The customer then pays for the flight using a credit card or other payment method. The customer receives a confirmation email with their flight details. The customer prints out their ticket or stores it on their mobile device. The process is complete.

The process of building an airplane starts with the designers designing the aircraft. The designers then send the design to the production team. The production team begins to assemble the components of the aircraft. The components are then inspected and tested by the production team. The wings and fuselage are assembled and the engines are installed by the production team. The interior of the aircraft is then fitted with seats, lighting, and other amenities by the production team. The exterior is painted and the aircraft is tested for flight readiness by the production team. Finally, the aircraft is certified by the engineers. The process is complete.

Assembler AG places an order with the supplier in order to request more product parts. Assembler AG sends the order to the supplier. The supplier processes the order. The supplier sends an invoice to Assembler AG. Assembler AG receives the invoice.

The process starts with the car owner taking the car to a mechanic. The mechanic inspects the car to diagnose the problem. The mechanic then orders any necessary parts and tools needed to fix the car. The mechanic then begins to repair the car, replacing any broken parts and making any necessary adjustments. Once the repairs are complete, the mechanic tests the car to make sure it is running properly. The mechanic then provides the car owner with an invoice for the repairs. The car owner pays for the repairs and the mechanic provides the car owner with a receipt. The car owner then leaves the mechanic with their car, now fixed. The process is complete.

The process for getting elected as CEO of a company starts with the company's board of directors nominating a candidate. The board then reviews the candidate's qualifications and experience to determine if they are suitable for the role. If the candidate is approved, the board will then put forward a motion to the shareholders to vote on the candidate. The shareholders will then cast their votes. If the majority is in favor, the candidate gets elected as CEO by the board of directors. The process is complete.

The Customer Service Representative sends a Mortgage offer to the customer and waits for a reply. If the customer calls or writes back declining the mortgage, The Customer Service Representative updates the case details and archives the work. If the customer sends back the completed offer documents, the administration completes the case.

In November of each year, the Coordination Unit at the Town Planning Authority drafts a schedule of meetings for the next calendar year and adds draft dates to all calendars. The Support Officer then checks the dates and suggests modifications. The Coordination Unit then rechecks all dates and looks for potential conflicts.

A customer brings in a defective computer. The Computer Repair Service checks the defect and hands out a repair cost calculation back. If the customer decides that the costs are acceptable, the process continues, otherwise the customer takes the computer home unrepaired and the process ends. The repair consists of two activities, which are executed, in an arbitrary order. First, the Computer Repair Service checks and repairs the hardware. At the same time, the Computer Repair Service checks and configures the software. After each of these activities are finished, the Computer Repair Service tests the proper system functionality and the process ends.

The Evanstonian is an upscale independent hotel. When a guest calls room service at The Evanstonian, the room-service manager takes down the order. The room-service manager then submits an order ticket to the kitchen to begin preparing the food. The room-service manager also gives an order to the sommelier to fetch wine from the cellar and to prepare any other alcoholic beverages. Eighty percent of room-service orders include wine or some other alcoholic beverage. Finally, the room-service manager assigns the order to the waiter. While the kitchen and the sommelier are doing their tasks, the waiter readies a cart. Once the food, wine, and cart are ready, the waiter delivers the cart to the guests room. After returning to the room-service station, the waiter debits the guests account.

First, the company selects the underwriters. The underwriters provide the company with procedural and financial advice, then buy the issue, and finally resell the issue to the public. After that, the underwriters prepare a registration statement for the approval of the Securities and Exchange Commission. At the same time, the underwriters check that the issue complies with the laws of each state that regulate sales of securities within the state. After that, the underwriters begin to firm up the issue price. The underwriters arrange a road show to talk to potential investors. After that, the underwriters fix the issue price. Finally, the underwriters enter into a firm commitment to buy the stock and then offer the stock to the public.

The process will be carried out by the student, the employer and the professor. The process begins with the student choosing his internship preferences. After that, a series of task follows that will be performed by the professor: storing the student's preferences, allocating the student, confirming the allocation, getting the employer's details, informing the employer about the allocation and finally informing the student about the allocation. Then, the employer evaluates the candidate. After that, the employer confirms the evaluation. If the student is not accepted, the professor informs the student via email. After that, the student chooses his preferences again. If the student is accepted, the professor informs the student via email. After that, the student fills out the application form. The professor then updates the Baserow database, creates a confirmation document and sends the confirmation to the student. After that, the student sends his internship notes, and the professor updates the Baserow database.

The process begins by the online shop sending the offer to the customer. The customer receives the offer. IF the customer declines the offer, the process terminates. Otherwise, the customer sends the confirmation to the online shop. The online shop receives the confirmation. The customer then sends the payment, and the online shop receives the payment. The online shop then sends the invoice to the customer and dispathes the goods to the customer. The customer receives the invoice and receives the goods at the same time. After that, the process terminates.

The process starts with the customer placing an order for a product. The order is received by the sales team and added to the system. The sales team notifies the warehouse team. The warehouse team prepares the product for shipment, packs the product and ships the product to the customer. The customer receives the product and the process is complete.

The process starts when an individual submits an application for a building permit. The application is reviewed by the local government to ensure that it meets all the necessary requirements. If the application is rejected, the process ends. If the application is accepted, the local government will issue a building permit. Once the building permit is issued, the individual can begin construction on the project. After construction is completed, the local government will inspect the project to ensure that it meets all the necessary safety and building codes. If the project passes inspection, the local government will issue a certificate of occupancy. The process instance is then finished.

At the beginning the customer perceives that her subscribed service has degraded. The customer sends a list with all the problem parameters to the Customer Service department. The Customer Service department enters a problem report into the system. After that the Customer Service department determines the necessary counter measures. The Customer Service department creates a detailed problem report and sends the report to Service Management. Service Management receives the detailed problem report. After that, Service Management investigates whether the problem is analyzable at the level of their department. If the problem is analyzable, Service Management performs the analysis and creates a trouble report that indicates the type of problem. If the problem is not analyzable, Service Management sends the report to Resource Provisioning. Resource Provisioning receives the detailed problem report and checks whether there are any possible problems.  If no problems are detected, Resource Provisioning creates a notification about the normal service execution and sends the notification to Service Management. If a problem is detected, Resource Provisioning creates a trouble report and sends the report to Service Management. Service Management receives the information. After that, Service Management creates the final status report. Service Management sends the report to the customer and the process ends.

The process starts with the customer filling out an application for a loan. The application is reviewed by the lending team to determine the customer's eligibility for the loan. If the customer is not eligible for the loan, the process terminates. If the customer is eligible for the loan, the lending team sends the application to the underwriting department for further review. The underwriting team reviews the application and makes a decision on whether to approve the loan. If the loan is not approved, the process ends. If the loan is approved, the lending team processes the loan and disburses the funds to the customer. The customer receives the loan and the process is complete.

The process starts with the customer booking a flight online. The booking is confirmed by the airline and a reservation is made. The customer receives a confirmation email with the details of their flight. The customer checks in for their flight online or at the airport. The customer goes through security and boards their flight. The flight takes off and the customer arrives at their destination. The process is complete.

The process starts with the customer visiting a restaurant and being seated by the host. The customer looks at the menu and makes a selection. The order is taken by the server. The server then sends the order to the kitchen. The kitchen staff prepares the order and sends it out to the customer. The customer enjoys their meal and pays the bill. The process is complete.

The process starts with the customer going to a store to purchase a product. The customer finds the product they are looking for and takes the product to the checkout. The checkout staff scans the product and processes the payment. The customer pays for the product and receives a receipt. The customer leaves the store with their purchased product. The process is complete.

The process starts with the customer submitting a request for a loan. The request is reviewed by the lending team to determine the customer's eligibility for the loan. If the customer is eligible for the loan, the lending team sends the request to the underwriting department for further review. The underwriting team performs a credit check on the customer and reviews the customer's financial information to determine their ability to repay the loan. If the customer's credit and financial information meet the requirements, the underwriting team approves the loan and sends the information to the processing department. The processing department verifies the customer's information, prepares the loan documents and sends the documents to the customer. The customer signs the documents and returns the documents to the processing department. The processing department finalizes the loan and disburses the funds to the customer. The customer receives the loan and the process is complete.

The process starts with the customer ordering a product online. The order is received by the warehouse. The warehouse prepares the order for shipment, packages the product and ships the product to the customer. The customer receives the product and the process is complete.

The process starts with the customer booking a hotel room online. The hotel confirms the booking and makes a reservation. The customer receives a confirmation email with the details of their reservation. The customer arrives at the hotel and checks in. The customer enjoys their stay and checks out when they are ready to leave. The process is complete.

The process starts with the candidate applying for a job online. The application is reviewed by the HR team to determine the candidate's eligibility for the job. If the candidate is eligible for the job, the HR team schedules an interview. The candidate attends the interview. The hiring manager evaluates the candidate. If the candidate is selected for the job, the candidate is offered the position by the hiring manager. The candidate accepts the offer and starts the new job and the process is complete.

The process starts with the customer submitting a request for a service. The request is reviewed by the service team to determine its feasibility. If the request is not feasible, the process terminates. If the request is feasible, the service team schedules the service. The service is performed by the appropriate team and the customer is notified when it is complete. The customer pays for the service and the process is complete.

The process starts when an individual applies for a work permit. The application is then reviewed by the relevant government department to determine if the individual meets the criteria for a work permit. If the individual does not meet the criteria, the process instance is finished. If the individual does meet the criteria, the government department will issue a work permit. The individual must then submit the work permit to their employer. The employer reviews the work permit and confirms that they are able to employ the individual. Once the employer has confirmed the work permit, the individual can begin working. The process instance is then finished.

The process starts with the customer submitting a support request. The request is reviewed by the support team. The support team assigns the request to the appropriate team. The support agent responds to the request and provides the necessary support to the customer. The customer's issue is resolved and the process is complete.

The claims officer examines the claim. The claims officer then writes a settlement recommendation. The senior claims officer then checks the recommendation, and marks the recommendation. If the recommendation is marked as "Not OK", the senior claims officer sends the recommendation to the claims officer and the claims officer writes a settlement recommendation again. If the claim is marked as "OK", the process ends.

The process begins when the customer places an order through an online store or by contacting the company directly. The order is received by the company and the payment is processed. The company picks the product from the inventory and prepares the product for shipping. The company then ships the product to the customer, either through a courier service or by some other means. The customer receives the product and the process is complete.

The process begins when the conference organizer receives approval to proceed with booking the venue and ordering food. The organizer contacts several potential venues and requests quotes for the conference. At the same time, the organizer contacts several caterers and requests quotes for the food. The organizer reviews the quotes and selects a venue and a caterer. The organizer sends a deposit to the venue and caterer to secure the booking. The venue and caterer confirm the booking and the process is complete.

The process begins when the product launch is approved by the company's management team. A market research team is assigned to conduct a survey of potential customers to gather insights about the product and its potential market. At the same time, a marketing team is assigned to develop a plan for promoting the product, including advertising and public relations activities. The market research team completes the survey and presents the results to the product launch team. The marketing team completes the marketing plan and presents it to the product launch team. The product launch team reviews the market research and marketing plan and makes any necessary adjustments. The product is launched by the product launch team and the process is complete.

The process begins when the patient arrives at the hospital and is registered at the front desk by the receptionist. The admitting physician reviews the patient's medical history and orders any necessary lab tests. At the same time, the hospital's logistics team arranges for a bed to be available for the patient. The nursing staff assigns a nurse to the patient and provides them with any necessary medication or treatment. The lab tests are completed and the results are reviewed by the admitting physician. The patient is admitted to the hospital and the process is complete.

The process begins when the university receives an application for admission. The admissions office reviews the application and requests the applicant's transcripts and test scores. At the same time, the admissions office begins evaluating the transcripts to determine the applicant's academic qualifications. The admissions office receives the test scores and evaluates the test scores to determine the applicant's aptitude for the program. The admissions office reviews the transcripts and test scores and makes a decision about the applicant's eligibility for admission. The applicant is notified of the decision by the admission office and the process is complete.

The process begins with the customer placing an order for a product. The order is then received by the company and the payment is processed. The company picks the product from the warehouse and packages the product for shipping. The company then ships the package to the customer's address and provides a tracking number to the customer. Once the package arrives, the customer can open the package and inspect the product. If the customer is satisfied, the customer keeps the package. If the customer is not satisfied, he returns the package for a refund or exchange.

The process of buying milk begins when the customer enters the store and selects the type of milk they would like to purchase. The customer then takes the milk to the checkout counter, where they pay for the milk using cash or a credit card. The cashier scans the item and adds the item to the customer's total. The customer pays for the milk. The customer receives the receipt and the milk. The customer leaves the store with their purchase.

The process begins when the student applies to college and submits all necessary documents. The college reviews the application and decides whether to accept the student. If accepted, the student is required to pay a deposit to secure their place in the college. The college then sends out an acceptance letter and any other necessary information. The student then arranges for housing, books, and other supplies needed for college. The student then registers for classes and attends orientation. Finally, the student begins attending classes and the process ends.

The process starts when the business decides to file for bankruptcy. The business must then complete the necessary paperwork and submit the paperwork to the court. The court reviews the paperwork and determines if the business is eligible to file for bankruptcy. If the filing is approved, the business must then attend a meeting of creditors. At this meeting, the creditors can ask questions about the business's financial situation and assets. After the meeting of creditors, the court will issue a discharge order, which releases the business from their debts. The process instance is then finished.

The process begins when the customer arrives at the restaurant and takes a seat. The server takes the customer's order and passes the order on to the kitchen staff. The kitchen staff prepares the food according to the customer's order and sends the food out to the customer. The server then brings the food to the customer's table and collects payment. The customer pays for the food and the process is complete.
The customer request a loan. The risk assesment team assesses the request. If the customer is low risk, the bank approves the loan. If the customer is high risk, the bank denies the loan.

The process starts when the customer places an order. The sales department then checks the order and confirms the availability of the product. If the product is available, the sales department informs the warehouse and the shipping department. The warehouse then retrieves the product from its shelves and reserves the product for shipping. The shipping department then packages the product and arranges for the product's delivery. Once the product is ready to be shipped, the shipping department notifies the customer with a tracking number. The customer can then track the delivery of the product until it is delivered. The customer receives the product, the process instance is finished.

The process starts when the sales department receives an updated record of sales. A member of the sales department can then review the record and make any necessary changes. The member of the sales department approves the changes and informs the accounting department. The accounting department then updates the record in their system and checks for any discrepancies. If discrepancies are found, the accounting department reports the discrepancies to the sales department for further review. The accounting department updates the record in their system and informs the sales department that the record has been updated. The sales department then updates the record in their system.

The process starts when the HR department receives a new hire's paperwork. A member of the HR department can then reject or accept the paperwork. If the member of the HR department rejects the paperwork, the process instance is finished. If the member of the HR department accepts the paperwork, the member of the HR department informs the IT department and the payroll department. The IT department immediately sets up a computer and email account for the new hire. The payroll department prepares all necessary documents for payroll processing. After the IT setup and payroll preparation activities have finished, the HR department schedules an orientation meeting with the new hire. Afterwards, the HR department provides the new hire with all necessary information about the company and its policies. Finally, the HR department completes the onboarding process and finishes the process instance.

The process starts when the business owners decide to develop a business strategy. The business owners assemble a team of strategists. The team of strategists analyze the current state of the business and identify potential opportunities and threats. The team then creates a list of objectives and goals for the business. After that, the team develops a plan of action to achieve those objectives and goals. This plan includes strategies for marketing, operations, finance, and other areas of the business. The team then evaluates the plan and makes any necessary adjustments. Finally, the team presents the plan to the business owners for approval. Once approved, the plan is implemented by the business owners.

The process starts when the person decides to go to sleep. The person begins to prepare for bed. This includes brushing their teeth, changing into pajamas, and setting up their sleeping environment. After these activities have been completed, the person will lay down in bed and begin to relax. They may practice deep breathing or listen to calming music to help them drift off to sleep. Finally, the person falls asleep.

The process starts when a customer contacts the travel agency to arrange a vacation. The travel agent can then accept or reject the request. If the travel agent rejects the request, the process instance is finished. If the travel agent accepts the request, the travel agent begins to research and book flights, hotels, and other activities for the customer's vacation. The travel agent will then provide the customer with a detailed itinerary and cost breakdown of their vacation. The customer approves the itinerary and cost breakdown. The travel agent books the flights, hotels, and other activities. After the booking is complete, the travel agent will provide the customer with all necessary documents and information for their vacation. Finally, the travel agent will follow up with the customer to ensure that they have a pleasant experience.

The process starts when the customer makes a hotel reservation request. The reservation department then reviews the request and either rejects or accepts it. If the request is rejected, the process instance is finished. If the request is accepted, the reservation department informs the hotel staff and checks for availability. If there is availability, the reservation department reserves the room and sends a confirmation to the customer. If there is no availability, the reservation department informs the customer and the process instance is finished. The hotel staff prepares the room for the customer's arrival. The customer arrives, checks-in at the front desk and receives the room key. The process instance is then finished.

The process starts when a job seeker begins their search for a job. The job seeker can then research potential job opportunities and create a list of potential employers. The job seeker can then reach out to the employers on the list to inquire about open positions. If an open position exists, the job seeker can submit their resume and cover letter. The employer can then review the resume and cover letter and decide whether or not to invite the job seeker for an interview. If the decision is to invite, the job seeker can then prepare for the interview and attend the interview. After the interview, the employer can decide to reject or accept the job seeker's application. If the application is rejected, the process instance is finished. If the application is accepted, the job seeker can accept or reject the offer. If the offer is accepted, the job seeker can then begin their new job and finish th process instance.

The process starts when a candidate applies for a professor position at a university. The hiring committee reviews the candidate's application and decides whether to accept or reject the application. If the application is rejected, the process instance is finished. If the application is accepted, the hiring committee schedules an interview with the candidate. After the interview, the hiring committee evaluates the candidate's qualifications and decides whether to offer them the position. If the position is offered, the candidate must accept or reject it. If the offer is accepted, the human resources department processes the paperwork. The candidate can then begin teaching classes and fulfilling other duties as required by the university.

The process starts when an employee decides to quit their job. The employee informs their supervisor of their decision and provides a written notice of resignation. The supervisor then reviews the notice and either accepts or rejects the resignation. If the resignation is accepted, the employee completes any necessary paperwork and returns any company property. The supervisor then informs the Human Resources department of the employee's resignation. The Human Resources department then processes the paperwork and notifies the payroll department to stop payment for the employee. Finally, the employee receives a final paycheck and any other necessary documents.

The process starts when an individual decides to move to a different country. The individual then researches the country they are moving to and gathers information about the visa requirements, cost of living, job opportunities, and other important details. After that, the individual can begin the visa application process. After the visa application is submitted, the individual will wait for a response from the country's immigration office. If the visa is approved, the individual can then begin the process of packing and moving to the new country. The individual will need to register with the local government and obtain any necessary permits or licenses. Finally, the individual can begin their new life in the new country.

The process of Vacations Request starts when any employee of the organization submits a vacation request. Once the requirement is registered, the supervisor receives the request. The supervisor must approve or reject the request. If the request is rejected, the supervisor returns the application to the employee and the process ends. If the request is approved, the HR team generates a notification and completes the respective management procedures.

The process starts when the digging team receives the order to dig a hole. A member of the digging team can then reject or accept the order. If the member of the digging team rejects the order, the process instance is finished. If the member of the digging team accepts the offer, the digging team informs the supervisor and begins preparing for the job. The supervisor checks that all necessary tools and equipment are available. The digging team then begins to dig the hole according to the specifications. The supervisor inspects the hole to ensure it meets the requirements. If it does, the supervisor approves the job.

The process starts when the engineering department receives the order for a customized rocket. A member of the engineering department can then reject or accept the order. If the offer is rejected, the process instance is finished. If the offer is accepted, the member of the engineering department informs the storehouse and the manufacturing department. The storehouse immediately processes the part list of the order and checks the required quantity of each part. If the part is available in-house, the storehouse reserves the part. If the part is not available, the storehouse back-orders the part. In the meantime, the manufacturing department prepares everything for the assembly of the ordered rocket. After the reserving or back-ordering parts activity and the preparation activity have finished, the manufacturing department assembles the rocket. Afterwards, the engineering department tests and launches the rocket.

The process starts when a potential buyer expresses interest in purchasing the company. The seller can then reject or accept the offer. If the offer is rejected, the process instance is finished. If the offer is accepted, the seller informs their legal team and financial advisors. The legal team then reviews the offer and negotiates any necessary changes. Meanwhile, the financial advisors review the financials of the company and provide advice on the offer. The seller then decides whether to accept or reject the offer. If the offer is accepted, the buyer signs the purchase agreement and pays the agreed-upon amount. The seller then transfers ownership of the company to the buyer.

The process starts when a potential buyer expresses interest in purchasing the company. A member of the sales department can then reject or accept the offer. If the offer is rejected, the process instance is finished. If the offer is accepted, the member of the sales department informs the legal department and the finance department. The legal department immediately begins to draft and review all necessary documents for the sale. Meanwhile, the finance department prepares all financial documents and statements for due diligence. After the legal and finance activities have finished, the sales department negotiates the final terms of the sale with the buyer. Once the terms are agreed upon, the sales department finalizes the sale and transfers ownership of the company to the buyer.

The process starts when the founders decide to start a company. The founders can then decide to register the company with the local government or not. If the decision is not to register, the process instance is finished. If the decision is to register, the founders must fill out the necessary paperwork and submit it to the local government. After that, the founders must pay any applicable fees and wait for approval from the local government. After the founders receive approval, the founders must obtain any necessary licenses and permits. Once all the paperwork is completed and the fees are paid, the founders can officially open their business. The process instance is then finished.

The process starts when the software development team receives a request for a new software product. A member of the team can then reject or accept the request. If the request is rejected, the process instance is finished. If the request is accepted, the software development team informs the design and engineering departments. The design department then creates a prototype of the software product and presents it to the customer for approval. If approved, the engineering department begins to develop the software product. The engineering department then tests the software product to ensure it meets the customer's requirements. After the software product passes all tests, the engineering department deploys the software product and the process instance is finished.

The process starts when the production team receives the script. A member of the production team can then reject or accept the script. If the script is rejected, the process instance is finished. If the script is accepted, the member of the production team informs the casting department and the art department. The casting department immediately begins to cast actors for each role in the movie. The art department begins to design and build sets and props for the movie. In the meantime, the production team begins to secure locations for filming. After the casting and art departments have finished their activities, the production team begins to film the movie. Afterwards, the production team edits the movie and adds special effects. Finally, the production team ships the movie to theaters.

The process starts when a customer arrives at the Chinese restaurant. The customer is greeted by a member of the restaurant staff and is asked to choose a table. The customer chooses a table, and the staff member takes their order. The order is then sent to the kitchen by the staff member. The chefs prepare the meal according to the customer's specifications. Once the meal is ready, the meal is served to the customer by the staff member. The customer eats the meal, pays for the meal and leaves the restaurant. The process instance is then finished.

The process starts when the organizing committee receives the application for the sports contest. The organizing committee can then reject or accept the application. If the application is rejected, the process instance is finished. If the application is accepted, the organizing committee informs the venue and other necessary departments. The venue immediately processes the requirements for hosting the contest and checks if all necessary facilities are available. If all facilities are available, the venue reserves the facilities. If any facility is not available, the venue back-orders the facility. In the meantime, the organizing committee prepares everything for the contest. After the reserving or back-ordering facilities activity and the preparation activity have finished, the organizing committee holds the sports contest. Afterwards, the organizing committee evaluates the results of the contest.

The process starts when a person decides to run for president of a country. The person must then register as a candidate with the relevant election commission. After registering, the candidate must collect signatures from eligible voters in order to be placed on the ballot. The candidate then must submit their candidacy to the election commission. The election commission then verifies the signatures and approves the candidacy. The candidate then campaigns for votes and engages in debates with other candidates. On election day, eligible voters cast their ballots. If the candidate receives the most votes, the candidate is declared the winner by the election commision and becomes the president of the country. The process instance is then finished.

An employee purchases a product or service he requires. For instance, a sales person on a trip rents a car. The employee submits an expense report with a list of items, along with the receipts for each item. A supervisor reviews the expense report and approves or rejects the report. If the supervisor rejects the report, the employee edits the report. If the supervisor approves the report, the supervisor sends the report to the treasurer. The treasurer checks that all the receipts have been submitted.

The process starts when a group of individuals decide to form a political party. The group of individuals must then decide on the name, mission statement, and goals of the party. Once these decisions have been made, the group of individuals must register the party with the local government. After the registration is complete, the group of individuals must create a website and social media accounts to promote their party and its platform. The group of individuals has to also create a logo and other branding materials. Once these steps are complete, the group of individuals must begin recruiting members and raising funds for their party. The group of individuals must also create a strategy for engaging with the public and promote their party. Finally, the group of individuals must register to participate in any upcoming elections. Once these steps are complete, the process instance is finished and the political party is officially founded.

The process starts when a group of individuals decide to found a university. The group of individuals then creates a business plan and submits it to the relevant government agency for approval. If the plan is approved, the group of individuals can then begin the process of setting up the university. The group of individuals can then begin recruiting students and faculty, and setting up the necessary infrastructure for the university. After the university is established, the group of individuals can then begin offering courses and programs to students. Finally, the university can be officially opened and the process instance is finished.

The process starts when a student applies to a university for a master's degree. The university can then accept or reject the application. If the application is rejected, the process instance is finished. If the application is accepted, the student enrolls in the program and begins their coursework. The student must complete all required courses and pass any necessary exams in order to progress in the program. Once all coursework is completed, the student must submit a thesis or dissertation to demonstrate their mastery of the subject. After the thesis or dissertation is accepted, the student is awarded their master's degree by the university and the process instance is finished.

The process starts when the student receives the test. The student can then decide to accept or reject the test. If the test is rejected, the process instance is finished. If the test is accepted, the student begins to create a study plan, gather any necessary materials and study the material. After that, the student takes the test. Afterwards, the student receives their results.

The process starts when a student applies for a residency program. The admissions department reviews the application and can either reject or accept the student's application. If the application is rejected, the process instance is finished. If the application is accepted, the admissions department informs the student of their acceptance and provides the student with information about the residency program. The student then completes any necessary paperwork and submits it to the admissions department. The admissions department reviews the paperwork. If everything is in order, the admissions department provides the student with a residency permit. The student then arranges for housing and other necessary accommodations. The student settles in and begins their residency program. At the end of the residency program, the student completes any necessary final paperwork and submits it to the admissions department. The admissions department reviews the final paperwork. If everything is in order, the admissions department provides the student with a certificate of completion.

The process starts when a student decides to pursue a career in neurosurgery. The student must then complete a four-year undergraduate degree in a related field such as biology, chemistry, or physics. After completing the undergraduate degree, the student must then apply to medical school and complete four years of medical school. After graduating from medical school, the student must then complete a residency program in neurosurgery, which typically lasts for seven years. During the residency program, the student will gain experience in the diagnosis and treatment of neurological disorders. After completing the residency program, the student must then pass a board certification exam in order to become a licensed neurosurgeon. Once the student has passed the board certification exam, the student can then practice as a neurosurgeon.

The process starts when the researcher develops a hypothesis and designs an experiment to test it. The researcher then obtains the necessary materials and equipment for the experiment. Next, the researcher sets up the experiment and records any relevant data. The researcher then runs the experiment and collects data. After the experiment is complete, the researcher analyzes the data and draws conclusions based on the results. Finally, the researcher writes a report summarizing the experiment and its results, and the process instance is finished.

The process starts with the author coming up with an idea for a book. The author then outlines the plot and characters of the book. The author begins writing the book. The author edits and revises the book until it is ready for publication. The author submits the book to a publisher. The book is then printed and made available for purchase by the publisher. The process is complete.

The process starts when the author submits the manuscript to the publisher. The publisher then reviews the manuscript and decides whether to accept or reject the manuscript. If the manuscript is rejected, the process instance is finished. If the manuscript is accepted, the publisher informs the editor and the design team. The editor then reviews the manuscript and makes any necessary changes. Meanwhile, the design team creates a cover for the book and prepares any other visuals that may be needed. After these activities have been completed, the publisher sends the book to the printer. The printer prints the book and ships it to the publisher. The publisher then distributes the book to bookstores and other retailers, and the process instance is finished.

The process starts when the taxpayer receives a notification of their tax liability. The taxpayer can then choose to pay the taxes in full or in installments. If the choice to pay in full, the taxpayer pays the taxes and the process instance is finished. If the choice is to pay in installments, the taxpayer must submit a payment plan to the tax authority. The tax authority then reviews the payment plan and either approves or rejects it. If the payment plan is approved, the taxpayer must make payments according to the payment plan. The taxpayer must also submit any required documents to the tax authority. After all payments have been made and all documents have been submitted, the tax authority will issue a receipt of payment and the process instance is finished.

The process starts when a potential buyer expresses interest in a luxury property. The real estate agent can then reject or accept the offer. If the offer is rejected, the process instance is finished. If the offer is accepted, the real estate agent informs the seller and the legal department. The legal department then prepares all necessary documents for the sale of the property. The seller then reviews and signs all documents. After all documents have been signed, the buyer pays for the property. The legal department then transfers the title of the property to the buyer and the process instance is finished.

The process begins with the student requesting an internship. After that, the student fills out a form where he chooses three companies to which he wants to apply. Then the AirtableService saves those preferences in the database. After that, the professor allocates the student to one of those three companies. This sends a notification to the student on Slack and email in parallel. Then the system sends an email to the selected employer who evaluates the candidate. If the evaluation is negative, the process returns to task selection. In the case of a positive outcome, an email is sent to the student that he has been accepted for practice. After that, the student fills out the internship application form and the Airtable service stores that application in the database. After completing the internship, the student submits the internship journal, which is again saved in Airtable by the system.

The process starts with the budget creator setting a budget goal. Then the budget creator decides on the budget categories and the amount to be allocated to each. After that, the budget creator enters the budget information into the budgeting software. This sends a notification to the budget creator on Slack and email in parallel. Then the system checks the budget entries and sends a notification to the budget creator if any errors are found. After the budget is approved, the budget creator sets up the budget tracking system. This involves entering the budget information into the tracking software, setting up the budget tracking system and setting up the budget alerts. Finally, the budget creator reviews the budget on a regular basis and updates it as necessary. The Airtable service stores the budget information in the database.

The process starts when the person making the cup of coffee gathers the necessary supplies. The person then fills a coffee mug with hot water from a tea kettle. The person then adds a scoop of ground coffee to a filter and places the filter in a coffee maker. The person then turns on the coffee maker and waits for the brewing process to finish. After the brewing process is complete, the person removes the filter and adds the desired amount of sugar and creamer. The person then stirs the cup of coffee and adds any extra desired ingredients. Finally, the person pours the cup of coffee into a mug and the process instance is finished.

The process begins with the student choosing his preferences. After that he fills out a form. At the same time, he also sends an email to the professor and prepares relevant paperwork. All these three activities are done at the same time. After filling out the form the student sends the form. After preparing the paperwork, the student decides whether to gather more documentation or not. If the decision is positive, he gathers the documentation. Otherwise, he sends the paperwork. Finally, after doing all of these tasks, the student starts the internship.

The process begins with the homeowner choosing the floor plan and design of the house. At the same time, they also review the budget and hire an architect to create the blueprints. After the blueprints are completed by the architect, the homeowner hires a contractor to build the house. The contractor then orders all the materials and submits the necessary permits. After the permits are approved, the contractor begins the construction process. The contractor and the homeowner consult regularly to discuss the progress and make any necessary changes. After the house is built, the contractor installs the electrical, plumbing and heating systems. Finally, once all the work is complete, the homeowner can move in and enjoy their new home.

The student applies to university. Then, the cat drinks milk. After that, the student drops out. Did you know that the sky is blue and this sentence does not make any sense? Finally, the cat walks away.

The student completes their college application. Then, the teacher grades their essay. After that, the student pays their tuition. Did you know that elephants can fly and this sentence still doesn't make sense? Finally, the student attends their first day of class.

The process starts with the baker gathering the necessary ingredients for the bread. The baker measures out the flour, yeast, salt, and other ingredients and mixes them together in a bowl. The baker kneads the dough until it is smooth and elastic. The baker then places the dough in a greased loaf pan and covers it with a damp cloth. The baker leaves the dough to rise for several hours. Once the dough has risen, the baker preheats the oven and places the loaf pan inside. The baker bakes the bread for the specified amount of time. Once the bread is done baking, the baker removes it from the oven and allows it to cool. The process is complete.

The process starts with the passenger booking a hotel online. The booking is confirmed by the hotel and a reservation is made. The passenger receives a confirmation email with the details of their stay. The passenger checks in at the hotel reception or online. The passenger goes to their room, unpacks, and enjoys their stay. The passenger checks out of the hotel and returns home. The process is complete.

The process starts when the sales department receives an order. A member of the sales department can then reject or accept an order for a customized bike. If A member of the sales department rejects the offer, The process is finished. If A member of the sales department accepts the offer , A member of the sales department informs the storehouse and the engineering department. the storehouse immediately processes the part list of an order and checks the required quantity of each part. If the part is available in-house, the storehouse reserves the part . If the part is not available, the storehouse back-orders the part . In the meantime, the engineering department prepares everything for the assembling of a customized bike . After the reserving or back-ordering parts activity and the preparation activity have finished, the engineering department assembles a customized bike . Afterwards, the sales department ships a customized bike to the customer and finishes The process .

The process starts with the customer searching for a flight online. the customer selects the desired flight and enters his personal information. the customer then pays for the desired flight using a credit card or other payment method. the customer receives a confirmation email with his flight details. the customer prints out his ticket or stores his ticket on his mobile device. The process is complete.

The process of building an airplane starts with the designers designing the aircraft. the designers then send the designers designing to the production team. the production team begins to assemble the components of the aircraft . the components of the aircraft are then inspected and tested by the production team as well. The wings and fuselage are assembled and the engines are installed by the components of the aircraft. The interior of the aircraft is then fitted with seats, lighting, and other amenities by the production team also. The exterior is painted and the aircraft is tested for flight readiness by the production team . Finally, the aircraft is certified by the engineers. The process is complete.

Assembler AG places an order with the supplier in order to request more product parts. Assembler AG sends an order to the supplier . the supplier processes an order . the supplier also sends an invoice to Assembler AG . Assembler AG receives an invoice .

The process starts with the car owner taking the car to a mechanic. a mechanic inspects the car to diagnose the problem. a mechanic then orders any necessary parts and tools needed to fix the car . a mechanic then begins to repair the car , replacing any broken parts and making any necessary adjustments. Once the repairs are complete, a mechanic tests the car to make sure the car is running properly. a mechanic then provides the car owner with an invoice for the repairs . the car owner pays for the repairs and a mechanic provides the car owner with a receipt. the car owner then leaves a mechanic with their car, now fixed. The process is complete.

The Customer Service Representative sends a Mortgage offer to the customer and waits for a reply. If the customer calls or writes back declining the mortgage, The Customer Service Representative updates the case details and archives the work. If The Customer Service Representative sends back the completed offer documents, the administration completes the case.

A customer brings in a defective computer. The Computer Repair Service checks the defect and hands out a repair cost calculation back. If A customer decides that the costs are acceptable, the process continues, otherwise A customer takes a defective computer home unrepaired and the process ends. the process consists of two activities, which are executed, in an arbitrary order. First, The Computer Repair Service checks and repairs the hardware. At the same time, The Computer Repair Service checks and configures the software. After each of these activities are finished, The Computer Repair Service tests the proper system functionality and the process ends.

The Evanstonian is an upscale independent hotel. When a guest calls room service at The Evanstonian , the room-service manager takes down the order. the room-service manager then submits an order ticket to the kitchen to begin preparing the food. the room-service manager also gives an order to the sommelier to fetch wine from the cellar and to prepare any other alcoholic beverages. Eighty percent of room-service orders include wine or some other alcoholic beverage. Finally, the room-service manager assigns the order to the waiter. While the kitchen and the sommelier are doing their tasks, the waiter readies a cart. Once the food , and a cart are ready, the waiter delivers a cart to the guests room. After returning to the room-service station, the waiter debits the guests account.

The process starts with the customer approaching the lemonade stand. the customer orders his desired drink and pays the seller. the seller takes the payment and prepares his desired drink . the seller hands the customer his desired drink and provides the customer with a receipt. the customer takes his desired drink and leaves the lemonade stand . The process is complete.

The process starts with the data scientist gathering the necessary data for the dataset. This could include images, text, audio, or video. the data scientist then preprocesses the necessary data for the dataset , which may include cleaning, normalizing, and formatting the necessary data for the dataset . Next, the data scientist splits the necessary data for the dataset into training and testing sets. training and testing sets is used to train the deep learning model while the testing set is used to evaluate its performance. Finally, the data scientist labels the data in order to create the dataset . The process is complete.

First, the Manager checks the open leads. Afterwards, the Manager selects the top five ones. the Manager then tells the Sales Assistant to call the contact person of open leads . the Sales Assistant calls each customer. If someone is interested, the Sales Assistant sends a note to the Manager . the Manager then processes the lead. Otherwise, the Sales Assistant calls the next customer.

The process starts with the data scientist gathering the necessary data for the model. the data scientist then cleans and pre-processes the necessary data for the model to prepare the necessary data for the model for modeling. the data scientist then splits the necessary data for the model into training and testing sets. the data scientist then builds the model using the training set. the model is then evaluated by the data scientist using the testing set to measure its accuracy. the data scientist then tunes the model to improve its accuracy. Finally, the data scientist deploys the model and monitors its performance. The process is complete.

The process starts with the curator selecting the artwork to be featured in the exhibition. the curator then arranges the artwork to be featured in the exhibition in the gallery space according to his vision. The gallery staff hang the artwork to be featured in the exhibition on the walls and set up any additional displays. the curator then reviews the setup and makes any necessary adjustments. The marketing team creates promotional materials for the exhibition and distributes promotional materials to potential visitors. The gallery staff then open the doors to the public and welcome visitors to the exhibition . The process is complete.

The process starts with the advertising team brainstorming ideas for the campaign. the advertising team then creates a concept and develops a strategy for the campaign . the advertising team then creates the visuals and content for the campaign , such as images, videos, and copy. the advertising team then work with media outlets to determine where the campaign will be placed. the advertising team then launches the campaign and monitors its performance. Finally, the advertising team evaluates the success of the campaign and makes adjustments as needed. The process is complete.
